article.name: Prevent - Mobile Experience
article.title: Prevent - Mobile Experience
article.body:
The Prevent experience is different on mobile compared to Microsoft Outlook Add-In. You will receive feedback in an email when a potential risk is identified. This email will provide a risk assessment summary and give you a chance to approve and send the email or reject and discard the email.

Depending on the configuration set by your admins, if you do not approve or reject this email, your email will automatically be sent or rejected after a given time period.

images.alt:
The image displays a security or compliance hold screen requiring user confirmation before sending an email.

**Context and Actions Section:**

*   **Primary Headline:** "We need to double check something..."
*   **Introductory Text:** "We need approval before we can send your message 'Test'."
*   **Action Buttons:** Two prominent buttons are provided:
    1.  A large, green button: "Approve and send email"
    2.  A large, red button: "Reject and discard email"
*   **Timeout Warning:** Below the buttons, text warns, "If we don't hear from you, we will automatically approve and send this email with **no changes made**" (the phrase 'no changes made' is emphasized in red).

**Summary Section:**

A section titled "Summary" provides the justification for the approval hold via bullet points:

*   **Policy Warning:** A bullet point states, "It is against company policy to send sensitive data to a personal email account," followed by an instruction to "Please review your email and any attachments before proceeding."
*   **Content/Recipient Anomaly:** A second bullet point notes that the email may be reviewed for compliance and highlights an anomaly: "Based on your previous email communications you wouldn't normally include [BLURRED TEXT] with the other recipients on this email." This is followed by a direct question: "Did you mean to include [BLURRED TEXT]?"
images.context: ummary and give you a chance to approve and send the email or reject and discard the email.
